Single leg squats are great for keeping your glutes tight and it also helps to prevent hip fractures. Osteoporosis isn't an old lady disease, in fact we start to lose bone quality at around age 35 and we see a bigger decline post menopause. Strong muscles mean Strong bones 💪🏽💪🏽💪🏽 #bonehealth

JOIN US for this FREE event on Wednesday, May 24th! #MBCPrimetimeMinistry in collaboration with #UHIP presents @rutgersu - #Newark #AfricanAmerican #BrainHealth Initiative. Joins us for this important conversation on the promotion of #brainhealth among #AfricanAmericanseniors. Who is most at risk for getting #Alzheimer’s disease? What regular #habits and #lifestyles are best for reducing your #risk for Alzheimer’s? How can we #improvememory and #brainfunction? These questions and many more, will be discussed and answered by a professional panel from #RutgersUniversity - Newark on Wednesday, May 24th, 12:00pm, at@messiah_baptist_church located at 13 – 17 Oak Street in East Orange, New Jersey. Lunch will be provided. YOU MUST RSVP by May 22nd to reserve your seat. Call (973) 676-8447. This event is free and open to the public. We encourage you to come!

#Safety #awareness #prevention

As most of you know bedbugs were once on the down low but have now returned and numbers are on the rise. With this ever growing problem it is key to learn what a bedbug is, where they hide and how to get ride of them and keep them gone for good.

They are elusive, nocturnal creatures. They can hide behind baseboards and in cracks, crevices and folded areas of beds, bedding and adjacent furniture, especially mattresses and box springs.

To give an example of what to look for, this photo is of a mother bedbug that has nested and laid eggs inside the screw hole of a wooden bed frame. Although wood isn't the only place they like to hide, wood knots, cracks and holes like these provide excellent harbourage spots for them to mate and lay eggs. Since bedbugs are only about the width of a credit card, they can squeeze into really small hiding spots. 
Bedbug control is complicated and lengthy, often needing multiple visits. This is definitely not a do-it-yourself project. If you leave one bed bug, the problem will not go away. To schedule a bedbug inspection by a Certified Pest Control Specialist, please call our office or book an appointment through our website.

#bedbugs #certifiedpestcontrol #prevention #awareness

・・・
I've had a super sticky shoulder lately and a few other nicks and nags. Volume and intensity of training is super high right now. I have committed to better warm ups and cool downs. Also, twice a week @chrischughes works to keep me up and running. He's very knowledgeable in all the prehab/rehab work. 💡
•••
Today is day 4 of using @crossoversymmetry as a part of my warm up to fix the sticky shoulder. My shoulder already feels 90% better! CRAZY!! I love this tool! Amazing what a good warm up will do!
•••
Also, I have been scraping shoulders, forearms and shins with my @sidekicktool twice a week on pt/recovery days. Keeping my body in tune! I would rather have a longer warm up than an injury to rehab. This is all apart of regionals prep too. The boring stuff is sometimes the best stuff. 🙌🏼 #Prevention #PT #RecoveryDay #CrossoverSymmetry #SidekickTool #CoverAllYourBases

Episode 433: "How To Still Do Yoga With Neck Pain"
[exercise technique]
.
Having neck pain with yoga? Does this first movement demonstrated aggravate it? Are there modifications available?
.
Regardless of how you describe this movement (cat camel, cat cow, angry cat, you name it..) here is a modification if you’re having neck pain! Excessive cervical flexion and/or extension repeatedly performed could be the reason for your neck pain. This is especially true for any new yogis out there because their body may not be use to moving through their extreme ranges of motion so often.
.
Demonstrated here is a modification to stabilizing the head and neck during this yoga movement. Instead of moving through full upper and lower cervical spine range of motion, you are now going to move the rest of your body on a stabilized head and neck. This is also a great way to work on neck strength and body awareness!

1️⃣Find your neutral spine - look all the way up and all the way down and then hold a position in the middle. 
2️⃣Keep your eyes focused straight ahead - the best cue for head and neck positioning is where you want the eyes to focus.
3️⃣Focus on moving through your thoracic spine and pelvis while best trying to stabilize your head and neck!
.
Try it out, let us know what you think. More importantly for any new yogis out there, it is OK to modify YOUR movement in any yoga class regardless of what people tell you. Do yoga smarter with [P]rehab. #yoga #catcamel #catcow #angrycat

Today I've been crying all day! I always said that 2016 was the year I was gonna become a mother. Instead I had cancer and had to give away my pet... so today was bit emotional... Clearly God has other plans for me. If your are lucky enough to be a mommy please check yourself regularly if not for you for your kids.

FIX YOUR HUNCHBACK POSTURE @dr.jacob.harden 
Here's an upper thoracic extension drill for you guys @quaddoc came up with a while back (as you can see by the orange walls.😅) when she was developing a rehab plan for one of our patients who hunches over at their desk all day.
. 
This drill ties together cervical retraction and upper thoracic extension and really forces you to control your thoracic spine. It's one of those 💣 bang for your buck 💵 exercises that helps with both neck and back pain.
. 
Put the 🔴 ball under your chest and then take the neck straight back as you lift your chest about two to three inches off. Any further and you're most likely cheating and pulling through the thoracolumbar area. Do this one to bias the cervicothoracic junction and help get rid of that hunchback posture and make your midback feel oh so nice.😁 Tag a friend with neck or back pain and share the wealth!
______________________________________________________

Merci aux 27,7K !!!

Miliaria is a common disorder of the eccrine sweat glands that occurs in 1.6%-4.5% of newborns.It often occurs in conditions of increased heat and humidity and is thought to be caused by blockage of sweat ducts, resulting in leakage of sweat into the epidermis or dermis. It is a generally asymptomatic, self-limited condition, but complications include altered heat regulation and secondary infection. .
